description:
Hannon Legal Group in Miami, Florida, dedicates its resources to helping victims of medical malpractice recover substantial compensation for injuries and losses they endure. Our law office is no stranger to medical malpractice cases, which tend to be some of the most intricate, expensive and hard-fought cases in the Florida courts. Despite the complexity of these cases, however, our attorneys have a long track record of successfully securing multimillion-dollar verdicts and holding negligent providers accountable. We attribute our success, in large part, to our unwavering commitment to making our community a safer place to live.

Though our law office practices strictly in the state of Florida, we have a national reputation for providing unwavering support and superior legal representation to injured parties. In addition to representing individuals in medical malpractice cases, we aggressively advocate on behalf of people who have fallen victim to:

• Serious personal injury
• Premises liability
• Insurance bad faith
• Motor vehicle accidents
• Nursing home negligence
• Wrongful death
• Negligent security
• Car accident

Hannon Legal Group is the recipient of several recognitions and awards, including U.S. News & World Report's Best Law Firms in America distinction. Firm partner, attorney James Hannon, is AV Preeminent peer-review rated,* the highest rating, through Martindale-Hubbell. He is also a member of the Multi-Million Dollar Advocates Forum.

When individuals turn to us for help, we use the free initial consultation to evaluate the strengths and weaknesses of a case to determine if it is one worth pursuing. When we do take on a case, we give it our undivided attention from beginning to end and during every in-person and virtual appointment. To help ease clients' financial burdens while a case is pending, we are happy to accept credit cards as payment.

*AV®, AV Preeminent®, Martindale-Hubbell Distinguished and Martindale-Hubbell Notable are certification marks used under license in accordance with the Martindale-Hubbell certification procedures, standards and policies. Martindale-Hubbell® is the facilitator of a peer-review rating process. Ratings reflect the anonymous opinions of members of the bar and the judiciary. Martindale-Hubbell® Peer Review RatingsTM fall into two categories - legal ability and general ethical standards.
